name: PHYS 216
title: Advanced Topics in Non-Relativistic Quantum Mechanics
description: Approximate methods: time-independent perturbation theory, variational principle, time-dependent perturbation theory; three-dimensional scattering theory; identical particles; permutation symmetry and exchange degeneracy, anti-symmetric and symmetric states; many-body systems and self-consistent fields: variational calculations; second quantized formalism, including Fock spaces/number representation, field operators and Green functions; applications: electron gas; quantization of the electromagnetic field and interaction of radiation with matter: absorption, emission, scattering, photoelectric effect, and lifetimes.

pre_req_data.text: Prerequisite(s): PHYS 215. Enrollment is restricted to graduate students only, except by permission of instructor.
